ns4:ProceedingDetails.ns4:ProceedingDescription: to be represented on an application for a child arrangements order - where the child(ren) will live

ns4:ScopeLimitation.ns4:ScopeLimitationWording: Limited to obtaining external Counsel's Opinion or the opinion of an external solicitor with higher court advocacy rights on the information already available.

Limited to Family Help (Higher) and to all steps necessary to negotiate and conclude a settlement. To include the issue of proceedings and representation in those proceedings save in relation to or at a contested final hearing.

ns3:Attribute.ns3:ResponseValue: – The Legal Aid Agency may cancel my legal aid and I will have to pay back all of my legal fees.
This declaration applies to all the information given in this application as summarised below, and to any evidence provided in support:

– Legal aid is not always free. I may have to pay a contribution towards my legal costs from my income and/or capital. My legal aid may be withdrawn if I fall in arrears of payment and I will be responsible for the outstanding payments.
– I may have to pay back all or part of my legal costs at the end of my case.
- To be signed in all non-passported cases (including clients living outside the UK) except where the client is a child under 16 or a protected party.
If I fail to notify the Legal Aid Agency of any change in my financial circumstances:

This is a true statement of all my and my partner’s (if applicable) income and assets in the UK and abroad. I understand that if I tell you anything untrue in this application, or the documents I send with it, or if I leave anything out:
– The Legal Aid Agency may take away my legal aid so I will have to pay back all my legal fees.

- I agree to the Legal Aid Agency checking these facts with others such as credit reference agencies, the Department of Work and Pensions and HM Revenue and Customs and I authorise those people/organisations to provide the information they are asked for.
I understand that I must co-operate fully and immediately with any enquiry into my financial circumstances. I will:
– Provide more evidence if the Legal Aid Agency ask.
– The more work my solicitor does, the more I may have to pay back.
- Tell the Legal Aid Agency immediately if anything I have said here changes.
– The Legal Aid Agency may register an interest-bearing charge against my property.

I understand if false or inaccurate information is provided and fraud is identified, details will be passed to fraud prevention agencies to prevent fraud and money laundering. For further details explaining how the information held by fraud prevention agencies may be used contact the Counter Fraud and Investigations team via email at MoJCounterFraudInv@justice.gov.uk.
- Legal aid is not always free.
This declaration applies to all the information given in this application as summarised below, and to any evidence provided in support:
Urgent directions to be complied with
- The Legal Aid Agency may register an interest bearing charge against my property.

I understand if false or inaccurate information is provided and fraud is identified, details will be passed to fraud prevention agencies to prevent fraud and money laundering. For further details explaining how the information held by fraud prevention agencies may be used contact the Counter Fraud and Investigations team via email at MoJCounterFraudInv@justice.gov.uk.
- I may have to pay back all or part of my legal costs at the end of my case.
Standard Family Merits, Family, Substantive DF, Application, Non Urgent
I give my permission for the Legal Aid Agency to make any enquiries of third parties and I authorise those third parties to give any information necessary to deal with this.

As far as I know, all the information I have given is true and I have not withheld any relevant information. I understand that if I knowingly give false information or withhold relevant information or fail to disclose any change in circumstances for the duration of my funding that my Legal Aid may be stopped and criminal proceedings may be taken against me.
- The more work my solicitor does, the more I may have to pay back.
My solicitors have given me to keep:
> The Legal Aid Agency’s leaflet about Legal Aid (‘Paying for your Legal Aid’ leaflet available at https://www.gov.uk/guidance/funding-and-costs-assessment-for-civil-and-crime-matters)

My solicitors have explained the LAA Statutory Charge to me. In particular, my solicitors have advised that if I recover or preserve any property or asset, the Statutory Charge may arise, which could be payable immediately or postponed and registered as an interest - bearing charge on my home at the Legal Aid Agency’s discretion.
to be represented on an application for a child arrangements order –where the child(ren) will live
